name: Brussels International Center of Research and Human Rights
goal:
Brussels International Center for Research and Human Rights (BIC) is a Brussels-based independent, non-profit, non-governmental organization committed to preventing and resolving crisis word-wide through in-depth research, analysis and galvanized efforts.
To this end, BIC functions as a neutral and impartial organization while also concentrating on enhancing cooperation and partnership between the private and public sector, in the academic field, technical and political spheres in order to promote human rights and shape policies for peaceful societies to flourish.
Our main goal is to defend the rights of the peoples in all parts of the globe, focusing mainly on the MENA region and other parts of Africa, while bringing a young and fresh perspective. Our philosophy is to take on paths that are rarely traced (Yes, there are still some), embracing different aspects and facets of the defense of human rights, by advocating for the protection of victims of terrorism, creating platforms for the humanization of refugees, supporting the right to work for all, analyzing fragile political transitions, tracing efforts at rehabilitation of war-affected settings and promoting democratic principles, all in a neutral, independent and ethical way, while also considering both sides of the story and different perspectives into local contexts.
interests: Education and training, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights
